page.title: 07DOUNE GARDENS
page.content: As Doune is situated in a rural area, all houses have gardens and there is a great interest among the local population in the cultivation of flowers and vegetables. Many of the old houses whose front doors open in to the street have beautiful walled gardens behind and even the new purpose-built retired people's flats have a comunal garden. "My house is right in front of a wood and we sometimes see a red squirrel darting about in the trees." Helen "My garden is really big. We've got a garden shed and it takes my dad quite a long time to dig it, it is so big." Robert "In my garden I have London Pride, Lilies, Lavender and two small trees. I have many others but I do not know the names yet." Bernadette
